AnyEvent.description: Any of counter overflow/underflow, setting UG, or update through slave mode, generates an update interrupt or DMA request

CounterOnly.description: Only counter overflow/underflow generates an update interrupt or DMA request

Disabled.description: Counter is not stopped at update event

Enabled.description: Counter stops counting at the next update event (clearing the CEN bit)

EdgeAligned.description: The counter counts up or down depending on the direction bit

CenterAligned1.description: The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags are set only when the counter is counting down.

CenterAligned2.description: The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags are set only when the counter is counting up.

CenterAligned3.description: The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags are set both when the counter is counting up or down.

Reset.description: Reset - the UG bit from the TIMx_EGR register is used as trigger output (TRGO)

Enable.description: Enable - the Counter enable signal, CNT_EN, is used as trigger output (TRGO)

Update.description: Update - The update event is selected as trigger output (TRGO)

ComparePulse.description: Compare Pulse - The trigger output send a positive pulse when the CC1IF flag is to be set (even if it was already high), as soon as a capture or a compare match occurred

OC1REF.description: OC1REF signal is used as trigger output (TRGO)

OC2REF.description: OC2REF signal is used as trigger output (TRGO)

Disabled.description: Slave mode disabled - if CEN = ‘1 then the prescaler is clocked directly by the internal clock.

Encoder_Mode_1.description: Encoder mode 1 - Counter counts up/down on TI2FP1 edge depending on TI1FP2 level.

Encoder_Mode_2.description: Encoder mode 2 - Counter counts up/down on TI1FP2 edge depending on TI2FP1 level.

Encoder_Mode_3.description: Encoder mode 3 - Counter counts up/down on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

Reset_Mode.description: Reset Mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter and generates an update of the registers.

Gated_Mode.description: Gated Mode - The counter clock is enabled when the trigger input (TRGI) is high. The counter stops (but is not reset) as soon as the trigger becomes low. Both start and stop of the counter are controlled.

Trigger_Mode.description: Trigger Mode - The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI (but it is not reset). Only the start of the counter is controlled.

Ext_Clock_Mode.description: External Clock Mode 1 - Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter.

Sync.description: The effect of an event on the trigger input (TRGI) is delayed to allow a perfect synchronization between the current timer and its slaves (through TRGO). It is useful if we want to synchronize several timers on a single external event.

NoFilter.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

RisingEdge.description: ETR is non-inverted, active at high level or rising edge

FallingEdge.description: ETR is inverted, active at low level or falling edge

Overcapture.description: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCRx register while CCxIF flag was already set

Match.description: If CC1 is an output: The content of the counter TIMx_CNT matches the content of the TIMx_CCR1 register. If CC1 is an input: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCR1 register.

Trigger.description: The TIF flag is set in TIMx_SR register. Related interrupt or DMA transfer can occur if enabled.
If CCx is an output: CCxIF flag is set, Corresponding interrupt or DMA request is sent if enabled. If CCx is an input: The current value of the counter is captured in TIMx_CCR1 register.

Update.description: Re-initializes the timer counter and generates an update of the registers.

Frozen.description: The comparison between the output compare register TIMx_CCRy and the counter TIMx_CNT has no effect on the outputs

ActiveOnMatch.description: Set channel to active level on match. OCyREF signal is forced high when the counter matches the capture/compare register

InactiveOnMatch.description: Set channel to inactive level on match. OCyREF signal is forced low when the counter matches the capture/compare register

PwmMode1.description: In upcounting, channel is active as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCRy else inactive. In downcounting, channel is inactive as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCRy else active

Disabled.description: Preload register on CCRx disabled. New values written to CCRx are taken into account immediately

Enabled.description: Preload register on CCRx enabled. Preload value is loaded into active register on each update event

Output.description: CCx channel is configured as output

NoFilter.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

Internal.description: The counter is incremented following each internal clock pulse

External.description: The counter is incremented following each valid clock pulse on the LPTIM external Input1

Immediate.description: Registers are updated after each APB bus write access

EndOfPeriod.description: Registers are updated at the end of the current LPTIM period

Positive.description: The LPTIM output reflects the compare results between LPTIM_ARR and LPTIM_CMP registers

Negative.description: The LPTIM output reflects the inverse of the compare results between LPTIM_ARR and LPTIM_CMP registers

Inactive.description: Deactivate Set-once mode, PWM / One Pulse waveform (depending on OPMODE bit)

Disabled.description: A trigger event arriving when the timer is already started will be ignored

Enabled.description: A trigger event arriving when the timer is already started will reset and restart the counter

SW.description: Software trigger (counting start is initiated by software)

RisingEdge.description: Rising edge is the active edge

FallingEdge.description: Falling edge is the active edge

Immediate.description: Any trigger active level change is considered as a valid trigger

Clocks2.description: Trigger active level change must be stable for at least 2 clock periods before it is considered as valid trigger

Clocks4.description: Trigger active level change must be stable for at least 4 clock periods before it is considered as valid trigger

Clocks8.description: Trigger active level change must be stable for at least 8 clock periods before it is considered as valid trigger

CKFLT.description:
Configurable digital filter for external
              clock

Immediate.description: Any external clock signal level change is considered as a valid transition

Clocks2.description: External clock signal level change must be stable for at least 2 clock periods before it is considered as valid transition

Clocks4.description: External clock signal level change must be stable for at least 4 clock periods before it is considered as valid transition

Clocks8.description: External clock signal level change must be stable for at least 8 clock periods before it is considered as valid transition

RisingEdge.description: The rising edge is the active edge used for counting. If LPTIM is in encoder mode: Encoder sub-mode 1 is active.

FallingEdge.description: The falling edge is the active edge used for counting. If LPTIM is in encoder mode: Encoder sub-mode 2 is active.

BothEdges.description: Both edges are active edge. If LPTIM is in encoder mode: Encoder sub-mode 3 is active.

Internal.description: LPTIM is clocked by internal clock source (APB clock or any of the embedded oscillators)

External.description: LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source through the LPTIM external Input1

High.description: The pin is high when ALRAF/ALRBF/WUTF is asserted (depending on OSEL[1:0])

Low.description: The pin is low when ALRAF/ALRBF/WUTF is asserted (depending on OSEL[1:0])

CalFreq_512Hz.description: Calibration output is 512 Hz (with default prescaler setting)

CalFreq_1Hz.description: Calibration output is 1 Hz (with default prescaler setting)

DST_Not_Changed.description: Daylight Saving Time change has not been performed

DST_Changed.description: Daylight Saving Time change has been performed

Sub1.description: Subtracts 1 hour to the current time. This can be used for winter time change outside initialization mode

Add1.description: Adds 1 hour to the current time. This can be used for summer time change outside initialization mode

ShadowReg.description: Calendar values (when reading from RTC_SSR, RTC_TR, and RTC_DR) are taken from the shadow registers, which are updated once every two RTCCLK cycles

BypassShadowReg.description: Calendar values (when reading from RTC_SSR, RTC_TR, and RTC_DR) are taken directly from the calendar counters

REFCKON.description:
RTC_REFIN reference clock detection
              enable (50 or 60 Hz)

RisingEdge.description: RTC_TS input rising edge generates a time-stamp event

FallingEdge.description: RTC_TS input falling edge generates a time-stamp event

ClockSpareWithOffset.description: ck_spre (usually 1 Hz) clock is selected and 2^16 is added to the WUT counter value

Tampered.description: This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the RTC_TAMPx input

Overflow.description: This flag is set by hardware when a time-stamp event occurs while TSF is already set

TimestampEvent.description: This flag is set by hardware when a time-stamp event occurs

Zero.description: This flag is set by hardware when the wakeup auto-reload counter reaches 0

Match.description: This flag is set by hardware when the time/date registers (RTC_TR and RTC_DR) match the Alarm B register (RTC_ALRMBR)
This flag is set by hardware when the time/date registers (RTC_TR and RTC_DR) match the Alarm A register (RTC_ALRMAR)

InitMode.description: Initialization mode used to program time and date register (RTC_TR and RTC_DR), and prescaler register (RTC_PRER). Counters are stopped and start counting from the new value when INIT is reset.

NotAllowed.description: Calendar registers update is not allowed

NotSynced.description: Calendar shadow registers not yet synchronized

UpdateNotAllowed.description: Wakeup timer configuration update not allowed

Pending.description: The RECALPF status flag is automatically set to 1 when software writes to the RTC_CALR register, indicating that the RTC_CALR register is blocked. When the new calibration settings are taken into account, this bit returns to 0

Add1.description: Add one second to the clock/calendar

SUBFS.description:
Subtract a fraction of a
              second

CALP.description:
Increase frequency of RTC by 488.5
              ppm

IncreaseFreq.description: One RTCCLK pulse is effectively inserted every 2^11 pulses (frequency increased by 488.5 ppm)

Eight_Second.description: When CALW8 is set to ‘1’, the 8-second calibration cycle period is selected

Sixteen_Second.description: When CALW16 is set to ‘1’, the 16-second calibration cycle period is selected.This bit must not be set to ‘1’ if CALW8=1

NotMasked.description: Tamper x event generates a trigger event and TAMPxF must be cleared by software to allow next tamper event detection

Masked.description: Tamper x event generates a trigger event. TAMPxF is masked and internally cleared by hardware. The backup registers are not erased.

Erase.description: Tamper x event erases the backup registers

NoErase.description: Tamper x event does not erase the backup registers

Disabled.description: Tamper x interrupt is disabled if TAMPIE = 0

Enabled.description: Precharge RTC_TAMPx pins before sampling (enable internal pull-up)

Immediate.description: Tamper event is activated on edge of RTC_TAMPx input transitions to the active level (no internal pull-up on RTC_TAMPx input)

Samples2.description: Tamper event is activated after 2 consecutive samples at the active level

Samples4.description: Tamper event is activated after 4 consecutive samples at the active level

Samples8.description: Tamper event is activated after 8 consecutive samples at the active level

TAMPTS.description:
Activate timestamp on tamper detection
              event

NoSave.description: Tamper detection event does not cause a timestamp to be saved

Save.description: Save timestamp on tamper detection event

RisingEdge.description: If TAMPFLT = 00: RTC_TAMPx input rising edge triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT ≠ 00: RTC_TAMPx input staying low triggers a tamper detection event.

FallingEdge.description: If TAMPFLT = 00: RTC_TAMPx input staying high triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT ≠ 00: RTC_TAMPx input falling edge triggers a tamper detection event

Disabled.description: Overrun functionality is disabled. If new data is received while the RXNE flag is still set the ORE flag is not set and the new received data overwrites the previous content of the RDR register

Enabled.description: An interrupt is generated whenever CTSIF=1 in the ISR register
CTS mode enabled, data is only transmitted when the CTS input is asserted
RTS output enabled, data is only requested when there is space in the receive buffer

Disabled.description: NACK transmission in case of parity error is disabled

Enabled.description: NACK transmission during parity error is enabled

NotSelected.description: Half duplex mode is not selected

Enabled.description: An interrupt is generated when FE=1 or ORE=1 or NF=1 in the ISR register

Discard.description: Set the TXE flags. This allows to discard the transmit data

Break.description: sets the SBKF flag and request to send a BREAK on the line, as soon as the transmit machine is available

Request.description: resets the ABRF flag in the USART_ISR and request an automatic baud rate measurement on the next received data frame

CompareOC4.description: OC4REF signal is used as trigger output

OnCompare.description: CCx DMA request sent when CCx event occurs

OnUpdate.description: CCx DMA request sent when update event occurs

NotInverted.description: ETR is noninverted, active at high level or rising edge

Inverted.description: ETR is inverted, active at low level or falling edge

Enabled.description: External clock mode 2 enabled. The counter is clocked by any active edge on the ETRF signal.

NoFilter.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

Sync.description: The effect of an event on the trigger input (TRGI) is delayed to allow a perfect synchronization between the current timer and its slaves (through TRGO). It is useful if we want to synchronize several timers on a single external event.

Disabled.description: Slave mode disabled - if CEN = ‘1 then the prescaler is clocked directly by the internal clock.

Encoder_Mode_1.description: Encoder mode 1 - Counter counts up/down on TI2FP1 edge depending on TI1FP2 level.

Encoder_Mode_2.description: Encoder mode 2 - Counter counts up/down on TI1FP2 edge depending on TI2FP1 level.

Encoder_Mode_3.description: Encoder mode 3 - Counter counts up/down on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

Reset_Mode.description: Reset Mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter and generates an update of the registers.

Gated_Mode.description: Gated Mode - The counter clock is enabled when the trigger input (TRGI) is high. The counter stops (but is not reset) as soon as the trigger becomes low. Both start and stop of the counter are controlled.

Trigger_Mode.description: Trigger Mode - The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI (but it is not reset). Only the start of the counter is controlled.

Ext_Clock_Mode.description: External Clock Mode 1 - Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter.

Overcapture.description: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCRx register while CCxIF flag was already set

Match.description: If CC1 is an output: The content of the counter TIMx_CNT matches the content of the TIMx_CCR1 register. If CC1 is an input: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCR1 register.

Trigger.description: The TIF flag is set in TIMx_SR register. Related interrupt or DMA transfer can occur if enabled.
If CC1 is an output: CC1IF flag is set, Corresponding interrupt or DMA request is sent if enabled. If CC1 is an input: The current value of the counter is captured in TIMx_CCR1 register.

Update.description: Re-initializes the timer counter and generates an update of the registers.

Disabled.description: Preload register on CCR2 disabled. New values written to CCR2 are taken into account immediately

Enabled.description: Preload register on CCR2 enabled. Preload value is loaded into active register on each update event

Output.description: CC2 channel is configured as output

Frozen.description: The comparison between the output compare register TIMx_CCRy and the counter TIMx_CNT has no effect on the outputs

ActiveOnMatch.description: Set channel to active level on match. OCyREF signal is forced high when the counter matches the capture/compare register

InactiveOnMatch.description: Set channel to inactive level on match. OCyREF signal is forced low when the counter matches the capture/compare register

PwmMode1.description: In upcounting, channel is active as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCRy else inactive. In downcounting, channel is inactive as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCRy else active

Disabled.description: Preload register on CCR1 disabled. New values written to CCR1 are taken into account immediately

Enabled.description: Preload register on CCR1 enabled. Preload value is loaded into active register on each update event

Output.description: CC1 channel is configured as output

TI2.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TI2

TI1.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TI1

TRC.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TRC

NoFilter.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

NoPrescaler.description: no prescaler, capture is done each time an edge is detected on the capture input

Two_Events.description: Capture is done once every 2 events

Four_Events.description: Capture is done once every 4 events

Eight_Events.description: Capture is done once every 8 events

TI1.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TI1

TI2.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TI2

TRC.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TRC

Disabled.description: Preload register on CCR4 disabled. New values written to CCR4 are taken into account immediately

Enabled.description: Preload register on CCR4 enabled. Preload value is loaded into active register on each update event

Output.description: CC4 channel is configured as output

Frozen.description: The comparison between the output compare register TIMx_CCRy and the counter TIMx_CNT has no effect on the outputs

ActiveOnMatch.description: Set channel to active level on match. OCyREF signal is forced high when the counter matches the capture/compare register

InactiveOnMatch.description: Set channel to inactive level on match. OCyREF signal is forced low when the counter matches the capture/compare register

PwmMode1.description: In upcounting, channel is active as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCRy else inactive. In downcounting, channel is inactive as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCRy else active

Disabled.description: Preload register on CCR3 disabled. New values written to CCR3 are taken into account immediately

Enabled.description: Preload register on CCR3 enabled. Preload value is loaded into active register on each update event

Output.description: CC3 channel is configured as output

TI4.description: CC4 channel is configured as input, IC4 is mapped on TI4

TI3.description: CC4 channel is configured as input, IC4 is mapped on TI3

TRC.description: CC4 channel is configured as input, IC4 is mapped on TRC

TI3.description: CC3 channel is configured as input, IC3 is mapped on TI3

TI4.description: CC3 channel is configured as input, IC3 is mapped on TI4

TRC.description: CC3 channel is configured as input, IC3 is mapped on TRC

HSI.description: TIM2 ETR input is connected to HSI16 when HSI16OUTEN bit is set

LSE.description: TIM2 ETR input is connected to LSE

COMP2_OUT.description: TIM2 ETR input is connected to COMP2_OUT

COMP1_OUT.description: TIM2 ETR input is connected to COMP1_OUT

COMP2_OUT.description: TIM2 TI4 input connected to COMP2_OUT

COMP1_OUT.description: TIM2 TI4 input connected to COMP1_OUT

Filter1.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 1 tI2CCLK

Filter2.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 2 tI2CCLK

Filter3.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 3 tI2CCLK

Filter4.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 4 tI2CCLK

Filter5.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 5 tI2CCLK

Filter6.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 6 tI2CCLK

Filter8.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 8 tI2CCLK

Filter9.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 9 tI2CCLK

Filter10.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 10 tI2CCLK

Filter11.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 11 tI2CCLK

Filter12.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 12 tI2CCLK

Filter13.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 13 tI2CCLK

Filter14.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 14 tI2CCLK

Filter15.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 15 tI2CCLK

Disabled.description: General call disabled. Address 0b00000000 is NACKed

Enabled.description: General call enabled. Address 0b00000000 is ACKed

Disabled.description: Host address disabled. Address 0b0001000x is NACKed

Enabled.description: Host address enabled. Address 0b0001000x is ACKed

Disabled.description: Device default address disabled. Address 0b1100001x is NACKed

Enabled.description: Device default address enabled. Address 0b1100001x is ACKed

Disabled.description: In device mode (SMBHEN=Disabled) Releases SMBA pin high and Alert Response Address Header disabled (0001100x) followed by NACK. In host mode (SMBHEN=Enabled) SMBus Alert pin (SMBA) not supported

Enabled.description: In device mode (SMBHEN=Disabled) Drives SMBA pin low and Alert Response Address Header enabled (0001100x) followed by ACK.In host mode (SMBHEN=Enabled) SMBus Alert pin (SMBA) supported

Software.description: Software end mode: TC flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low

Automatic.description: Automatic end mode: a STOP condition is automatically sent when NBYTES data are transferred

Completed.description: The transfer is completed after the NBYTES data transfer (STOP or RESTART will follow)

NotCompleted.description: The transfer is not completed after the NBYTES data transfer (NBYTES will be reloaded)

Ack.description: an ACK is sent after current received byte

Nack.description: a NACK is sent after current received byte

Stop.description: Stop generation after current byte transfer

HEAD10R.description:
10-bit address header only read
              direction (master receiver mode)

Complete.description: The master sends the complete 10 bit slave address read sequence

Partial.description: The master only sends the 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address, followed by Read direction

Bit7.description: The master operates in 7-bit addressing mode

Bit10.description: The master operates in 10-bit addressing mode

Disabled.description: Own address 1 disabled. The received slave address OA1 is NACKed

Enabled.description: Own address 1 enabled. The received slave address OA1 is ACKed

Mask1.description: OA2[1] is masked and don’t care. Only OA2[7:2] are compared

Mask2.description: OA2[2:1] are masked and don’t care. Only OA2[7:3] are compared

Mask3.description: OA2[3:1] are masked and don’t care. Only OA2[7:4] are compared

Mask4.description: OA2[4:1] are masked and don’t care. Only OA2[7:5] are compared

Mask5.description: OA2[5:1] are masked and don’t care. Only OA2[7:6] are compared

Mask6.description: OA2[6:1] are masked and don’t care. Only OA2[7] is compared.

Mask7.description: OA2[7:1] are masked and don’t care. No comparison is done, and all (except reserved) 7-bit received addresses are acknowledged

Disabled.description: Own address 2 disabled. The received slave address OA2 is NACKed

Enabled.description: Own address 2 enabled. The received slave address OA2 is ACKed

Disabled.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect SCL low timeout

Enabled.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect both SCL and SDA high timeout (bus idle condition)

Disabled.description: Extended clock timeout detection is disabled

Enabled.description: Extended clock timeout detection is enabled

Write.description: Write transfer, slave enters receiver mode

Read.description: Read transfer, slave enters transmitter mode

NotBusy.description: No communication is in progress on the bus

Busy.description: A communication is in progress on the bus

Alert.description: SMBA alert event is detected on SMBA pin

Match.description: Received PEC does match with PEC register

NoMatch.description: Received PEC does not match with PEC register

Overrun.description: slave mode with NOSTRETCH=1, when an overrun/underrun error occurs

Error.description: Misplaced Start and Stop condition is detected

Match.description: Received slave address matched with one of the enabled slave addresses

NotEmpty.description: Received data is copied into the RXDR register, and is ready to be read
The TXDR register is not empty

Empty.description: The TXDR register is empty and the data to be transmitted must be written in the TXDR register

Clear.description: Clears the ALERT flag in ISR register
Clears the TIMOUT flag in ISR register
Clears the PEC flag in ISR register
Clears the OVR flag in ISR register
Clears the ARLO flag in ISR register
Clears the BERR flag in ISR register
Clears the STOP flag in ISR register
Clears the NACK flag in ISR register
Clears the ADDR flag in ISR register

NotReady.description: ADC not yet ready to start conversion

NotAtEnd.description: Not at the end of the samplings phase

Enabled.description: ADRDY interrupt enabled. An interrupt is generated when the ADRDY bit is set.

EOSMPIE.description:
End of sampling flag interrupt
              enable

Enabled.description: EOSMP interrupt enabled. An interrupt is generated when the EOSMP bit is set.
EOC interrupt enabled. An interrupt is generated when the EOC bit is set.

EOSIE.description:
End of conversion sequence interrupt
              enable

Enabled.description: EOS interrupt enabled. An interrupt is generated when the EOS bit is set.
Overrun interrupt enabled. An interrupt is generated when the OVR bit is set.

Active.description: ADC operating and may be converting

NotCalibrating.description: ADC calibration either not yet performed or completed

AWDSGL.description:
Enable the watchdog on a single channel
              or on all channels

AllChannels.description: Analog watchdog enabled on all channels

SingleChannel.description: Analog watchdog enabled on a single channel

Preserve.description: ADC_DR register is preserved with the old data when an overrun is detected

Overwrite.description: ADC_DR register is overwritten with the last conversion result when an overrun is detected

EXTEN.description:
External trigger enable and polarity
              selection

RisingEdge.description: Hardware trigger detection on the rising edge

FallingEdge.description: Hardware trigger detection on the falling edge

BothEdges.description: Hardware trigger detection on both the rising and falling edges

TriggerAll.description: All oversampled conversions for a channel are done consecutively after a trigger

TriggerEach.description: Each oversampled conversion for a channel needs a trigger

NotSelected.description: Input Channel is not selected for conversion

Selected.description: Input Channel is selected for conversion

MAIN_MODE.description: Voltage regulator in Main mode during Deepsleep mode (Stop mode)

LOW_POWER_MODE.description: Voltage regulator switches to low-power mode when the CPU enters Deepsleep mode (Stop mode)

STOP_MODE.description: Enter Stop mode when the CPU enters deepsleep

STANDBY_MODE.description: Enter Standby mode when the CPU enters deepsleep

Clear.description: Clear the WUF Wakeup flag after 2 system clock cycles
Clear the SBF Standby flag

External.description: External input analog voltage (Compare internally to VREFINT)

Disabled.description: Access to RTC, RTC Backup and RCC CSR registers disabled

Enabled.description: Access to RTC, RTC Backup and RCC CSR registers enabled
VREFINT is on in low-power mode

Disabled.description: VREFINT is off in low-power mode
Low-power modes exit occurs only when VREFINT is ready

Enabled.description: VREFINT start up time is ignored when exiting low-power modes

DS_EE_KOFF.description:
Deep sleep mode with Flash memory kept
              off

NVMWakeUp.description: NVM woken up when exiting from Deepsleep mode even if the bit RUN_PD is set

NVMSleep.description: NVM not woken up when exiting from low-power mode (if the bit RUN_PD is set)

MAIN_MODE.description: Voltage regulator in Main mode in Low-power run mode

LOW_POWER_MODE.description: Voltage regulator in low-power mode in Low-power run mode

MAIN_MODE.description: Voltage regulator on during Deepsleep/Sleep/Low-power run mode

LOW_POWER_MODE.description: Voltage regulator in low-power mode during Deepsleep/Sleep/Low-power run mode

Disabled.description: WKUP pin 2 is used for general purpose I/Os. An event on the WKUP pin 2 does not wakeup the device from Standby mode

Enabled.description: WKUP pin 2 is used for wakeup from Standby mode and forced in input pull down configuration (rising edge on WKUP pin 2 wakes-up the system from Standby mode)

Disabled.description: WKUP pin 1 is used for general purpose I/Os. An event on the WKUP pin 1 does not wakeup the device from Standby mode

Enabled.description: WKUP pin 1 is used for wakeup from Standby mode and forced in input pull down configuration (rising edge on WKUP pin 1 wakes-up the system from Standby mode)

AboveThreshold.description: VDD is higher than the PVD threshold selected with the PLS[2:0] bits

BelowThreshold.description: VDD is lower than the PVD threshold selected with the PLS[2:0] bits

NoStandbyEvent.description: Device has not been in Standby mode

StandbyEvent.description: Device has been in Standby mode

WakeupEvent.description: A wakeup event was received from the WKUP pin or from the RTC alarm (Alarm A or Alarm B), RTC Tamper event, RTC TimeStamp event or RTC Wakeup)

Ready.description: Regulator is ready in the selected voltage range

NotReady.description: Regulator voltage output is changing to the required VOS level

Ready.description: Regulator is ready in Main mode

NotReady.description: Regulator voltage is in low-power mode

Disabled.description: WKUP pin 3 is used for general purpose I/Os. An event on the WKUP pin 3 does not wakeup the device from Standby mode

Enabled.description: WKUP pin 3 is used for wakeup from Standby mode and forced in input pull down configuration (rising edge on WKUP pin 3wakes-up the system from Standby mode)
